uk.co.strangeskies.text

Class CamelCaseFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.strangeskies.text.CamelCaseFormatter

  • public class CamelCaseFormatter
extends Object
    A tool for formatting and unformatting series' of words to and from their camel case representation.

    For the purposes of application of camel case rules, any code point which has no case is considered to be the same case as the preceding letter.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CamelCaseFormatter.UnformattingCase
      Treatment of case when unformatting from camel case to separate words.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CamelCaseFormatter()
      Construct a formatter which delimits over whitespace, which does not format camel case with a leading upper case character, and which unformats camel case with case preserved.

      Construct a formatter with the given settings.

      Construct a formatter with the given settings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CamelCaseFormatter

        public CamelCaseFormatter()
        Construct a formatter which delimits over whitespace, which does not format camel case with a leading upper case character, and which unformats camel case with case preserved.

      • CamelCaseFormatter

        public CamelCaseFormatter(String delimiter,
                          boolean leadingCapital,
                          CamelCaseFormatter.UnformattingCase unformattingCase)
        Construct a formatter with the given settings. Specifying an exact delimiter in this was gives faster formatting than a delimiter pattern.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - the delimiter string
        leadingCapital - the leading capital setting
        unformattingCase - the unformatting case strategy

      • CamelCaseFormatter

        public CamelCaseFormatter(String canonicalDelimiter,
                          Pattern delimiterPattern,
                          boolean leadingCapital,
                          CamelCaseFormatter.UnformattingCase unformattingCase)
        Construct a formatter with the given settings. The given canonical delimiter should match the given delimiter pattern
        Parameters:
        canonicalDelimiter - the canonical delimiter string
        delimiterPattern - the delimiter pattern
        leadingCapital - the leading capital setting
        unformattingCase - the unformatting case strategy

    • Method Detail

      • getCanonicalDelimiter

        public String getCanonicalDelimiter()
        Returns:
        the canonical delimiter string for unformatting camel case strings

      • getDelimiterPattern

        public Pattern getDelimiterPattern()
        Returns:
        the delimiter pattern for formatting strings into camel case

      • isLeadingCapital

        public boolean isLeadingCapital()
        Returns:
        true if camel case should lead with a capital letter, false otherwise

      • getUnformattingCase

        public CamelCaseFormatter.UnformattingCase getUnformattingCase()
        Returns:
        the unformatting case strategy for this formatter

      • join

        public String join(List<String> words)
        Parameters:
        words - a sequence of words in a list
        Returns:
        the given sequence of words in camel case format, with a leading capital if specified

      • split

        public List<String> split(String string)
        Parameters:
        string - a string in camel case format
        Returns:
        the given camel case string split into words according to the unformatting case

      • format

        public String format(String words)
        Parameters:
        words - a sequence of words separated by the delimiter pattern
        Returns:
        the given sequence of words in camel case format, with a leading capital if specified

      • unformat

        public String unformat(String string)
        Parameters:
        string - a string in camel case format
        Returns:
        the given camel case string split into words according to the unformatting case, then joined about the delimiter string
